availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William A. Ousley (Hickman County, Kentucky, farmer )

body.p: Hickman County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Thomas T. Ousley and Jane Ousley. Married to Julia F. Ringo Ousley in Hickman County, Kentucky, on January 6, 1853. Father of Mason T. Ousley, Mary E. Ousley, and Emily J. Ousley. Farmer and student in Hickman County in 1850. Household owned one enslaved person in Hickman County in 1850. Farmer in Clinton in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Clinton in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, p. 47B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, p. 673.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, Clinton, p. 504.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, Clinton, p. 200A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994039, Hickman County Marriages.
